Class DeviceLine

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.scene.image.Image
      • DeviceLine

  • public class DeviceLine
extends javafx.scene.image.Image
    The DeviceLine class This class stores the image of the list of efficient and inefficient devices appearing on screen during the game, it stores an array representation of the pixels of the image, storing a 0 where there is no device, a 1 for an efficient device, and a -1 for an inefficient device..

    Course Information:

    ICS4U0 with Krasteva, V.

    Total Time Spent: 5 hours

    Version:
    6 06.09.2019 
     Version History:
 June 1:
 Maria wrote the DeviceLine class. She wrote the constructor, where she identified the colours present in efficient and inefficient objects (stored in effColours and ineffColours respectively). She also created a PixelReader object to read the pixels of the Image that every
 Deviceline object is associated with and to store whether no object, an efficient object, or an inefficient object is found at that pixel location. -- 1.5 hours
 June 2:
 Maria wrote the deviceType() method, which uses the colours 2-D array to return what kind of device is at a given pixel location. -- 2.5 hours
 June 3:
 Maria corrected a bug in this class, by marking a pixel location in the colours 2D array with 0 if a pixel is White or Transparent. Originally, it only marked it with a 0 if it was transparent, but White also indicates the presence of no specific device type. -- 1 hour
    Author:
    Maria Yampolsky and Vansh Juneja

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int[][] colours
      This 2 dimensional array stores a pixel by pixel representation of the DeviceLine image.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DeviceLine(java.io.InputStream path)
      This is the class constructor, it calls the Image class constructor to create an Image to associate with a DeviceLine object.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int deviceType(int x, int y)
      This returns an int representation of what kind of device is stored at a particular pixel location in the DeviceLine image, by referencing the colours 2D array.

    • Field Detail

      • colours

        private final int[][] colours
        This 2 dimensional array stores a pixel by pixel representation of the DeviceLine image. At each pixel location, 0 represents there being no device, 1 is an efficient device, -1 is an inefficient device

    • Constructor Detail

      • DeviceLine

        public DeviceLine(java.io.InputStream path)
        This is the class constructor, it calls the Image class constructor to create an Image to associate with a DeviceLine object. It also determines which pixels of the DeviceLine image stores no device, an efficient device, and an inefficient device.
        Parameters:
        path - This represents the path location of the file that stores the image for the DeviceLine object.

    • Method Detail

      • deviceType

        public int deviceType(int x,
                      int y)
        This returns an int representation of what kind of device is stored at a particular pixel location in the DeviceLine image, by referencing the colours 2D array.
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate of the pixel location being searched for
        y - The y coordinate of the pixel location being searched for
        Returns:
        0 if no device is stored at the pixel, 1 if an efficient device is stored there, and -1 if an inefficient device is stored there.
